description: Alloscardovia venturai is a species of bacterium that belongs to the phylum Actinobacteria. It was first isolated from the feces of a human individual. The cells of A. venturai are described as coccoid or rod-shaped, and they are non-spore-forming. This bacterium is considered a member of the normal gut microbiota in humans, though its specific role and interactions within the gut ecosystem are not yet fully understood. Phylogenetic analysis based on 16S rRNA gene sequencing has placed A. venturai within the genus Alloscardovia, which is a relatively newly described genus within the family Bifidobacteriaceae. Further research is needed to elucidate the ecology, physiology, and potential significance of this species in human health and disease.
